parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>True. The post refers to "Sigheti", implicitly referring to a candidate, although not naming them directly.  The context strongly suggests this is a political opponent of the poster, Ioan Turcin.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. This is a paid Facebook post, inherently designed for wide public reach. The content addresses issues relevant to the community of Paulis.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>Potentially True. While not explicitly advocating for or against a specific candidate by name, the post strongly criticizes the actions of "Sigheti" regarding tax reduction, framing it as a betrayal of promises made during the campaign. This could be interpreted as an attempt to influence voters' opinions negatively towards "Sigheti" and potentially positively towards Ioan Turcin, who is identified as the author of the post. The timing of the post, close to the election, further strengthens this interpretation.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>False. While the post presents information, it lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected of journalistic reporting. It is clearly biased, using emotionally charged language ("bate joc," "vânzător de iluzii," "ați prostit oamenii," "le-ați întors spatele oamenilor," "e rușinos") to discredit "Sigheti."  The purpose is not to inform neutrally but to persuade.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. While presented as a personal opinion, the post goes beyond expressing a viewpoint. It uses strong accusations and emotionally charged language to sway public opinion against a political opponent, exceeding the bounds of personal commentary and entering the realm of political campaigning.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>579099107818696</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post, while not explicitly mentioning a specific candidate's name, strongly criticizes "Sigheti," who is implied to be a political opponent of Ioan Turcin. The post uses emotionally charged language and accusations to negatively portray "Sigheti's" actions regarding tax reduction, potentially influencing voters' opinions. The timing of the post, close to the election, and its paid nature on a public platform suggest an intention to sway public opinion.  While the image is unrelated to the text, the paid nature of the post and its clear political intent make it likely to be considered electoral propaganda.  The lack of a CMF number does not automatically exclude it, as the law does not explicitly require it for all forms of political advertising.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Sigheti</name><impact>NEGATIVE</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>Ioan Turcin</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>INDEPENDENT</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Ioan Turcin, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări pe Facebook (ID: 579099107818696) după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, care conține critici vehemente la adresa lui „Sigheti”,  implicat implicit într-un context electoral, utilizând un limbaj emoțional și acuzații menite să influențeze negativ opinia publică față de acesta,  în beneficiul lui Ioan Turcin, autorul postării.  Efectul electoral este evident, având în vedere conținutul postării,  tonul acuzator și contextul electoral.  Fraze precum „bate joc”, „vânzător de iluzii”, „ați prostit oamenii”, „le-ați întors spatele oamenilor”, „e rușinos” demonstrează clar intenția de a manipula opinia publică.  Postarea, deși nu menționează explicit un partid, este o formă de propagandă electorală interzisă după încheierea perioadei de campanie.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
